moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4: I move up these pawns to give my queen and bishops room to manoeuvre...
moves.4. Qd5: Now I bring up my queen to attack the bishop...
moves.4... Nc6: ...so he covers it with his knight...
moves.5. Bc4: ...so  bring out my white-square bishop to line up a potential checkmate...
moves.5... Qf6: ...but he reads this plan by developing his queen.
moves.6. Nf3: So I bring up my knight to add further pressure to the bishop...
moves.6... Nge7: ...and he develops his other knight, attacking my queen...
moves.7. Bg5: ...and I attack his queen with my white-square bishop. Who has the stronger position in the centre: black (him) or white (me)?
moves.7... Qg6: He moves his queen out of the way...
moves.8. Nxe5: ...so I remove the bishop in the centre, and attack the queen again...
moves.10... c6 11. Nc3: ...and finally I develop my remaining knight.
moves.13... f5 14. Bc5: ...but I put it behind my queen...
moves.14... Re8: ...but he moves his rook out of harm's way...
moves.19. f3 Re8 20. g4 Bb7 21. Rd1: Now I bring a rook into play...
moves.21... Rac8 22. Rd4: ...and place it in the middle of the board.
moves.23... Rxe4 24. fxe4: ...so we swap, and now my white-square bishop is no longer pinned.
moves.24... c5 25. Bc4+: So now it attacks the king...
moves.25... Kh7 26. O-O: ...and I castle to bring my remaining rook into play.
moves.27. Bd3: ...so I retaliate by attacking the bishop...
moves.29... Rf6: ...and he puts his rook ahead of my f-pawn to stop it from exposing his king.
moves.30. g5: So I push my g-pawn forward to fork the rook and the h-pawn...
moves.31... Rf7: Now the rook is forced to retreat...
moves.32. f6+: ...so I advance my f-pawn to expose the king to the bishop...
moves.34. Bc4: ...so I move my other bishop to attack the bishop, which is concealing the rook...
moves.35... a4 36. Rf2 a3 37. Kg2 Kg8 38. Bf4: After wasting a couple of moves, I move my bishop between my rook and pawn, hoping he'll remove the latter to open up the f-file...
moves.39. Bg3: ...so I move my bishop away from the file to contest it...
moves.39... Rxf2+ 40. Kxf2: ...and get the exchange I was looking for.
moves.40... Kf7 41. Bxd6: Now, I eliminate the queenside pawns, one by one. One...
moves.44... Kxc4 45. h4: Now I get my right-hand pawn moving...
moves.45... Kc3 46. Kg3 Kxc2 47. Kg4 Kb1 48. K: ...and eliminate my opponent's last pawn to give mine a clear run.
moves.53... Ke7 54. Qf6+ Kd7 55. Kf7 Kc7 56. Q: ...and she helps to fnish the job.
